thing-type.label: ZMNHOD Flush Shutter DC
thing-type.description: Flush Shutter DC<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis Z-Wave module is used to control the motor of blinds, rollers, shades, venetian blinds, etc.. The module can be controlled either through a Z-Wave network or through the wall switch.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtpress service button S for more than 2 second or</li&gt <li&gtpress push button I1 three times within 3s (3 times change switch state within 3 seconds)</li&gt </ul&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<ul&gt<li&gtpress service button S for more than 6 second or</li&gt <li&gtpress push button I1 five times within 3s (5 times change switch state within 3 seconds) in the first 60 seconds after the module is connected to the power supply.</li&gt </ul&gt

parameter.name: config_10_2
parameter.label: 10: Activate/deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF
parameter.description: Activate/deactivate functions ALL ON / ALL OFF<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtModule responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controllerbelonging to the system.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: ALL ON is not active, ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON active, ALL OFF active

parameter.name: config_40_1
parameter.label: 40: Power report (Watts) on power change for Q1 or Q2
parameter.description: Power report (Watts) on power change for Q1 or Q2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means percentage, set value from 0 – 100 = 0% - 100%.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 1</li&gt <li&gt0 - reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Reporting enabled. Power report is send (push) only when actual power (in Watts) in real time changes for more than set percentage comparing to previous actual power in Watts, step is 1%.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE</strong&gt: if power changed is less than 1W, the report is not send (pushed), independent of percentage set. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_42_2
parameter.label: 42: Power report (Watts) by time interval for Q1 or Q2
parameter.description: Power report (Watts) by time interval for Q1 or Q2<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value means time interval (0 – 32767) in seconds, when power report is send.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 300 = 300s</li&gt <li&gt0 - Reporting Disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 - 32767 = 1 second - 32767 seconds. Reporting enabled, power report is send with time interval set by entered value. </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_71_1
parameter.label: 71: Operating modes
parameter.description: Operating modes<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines selection between two available operating modes.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 - Shutter mode</li&gt <li&gt1 - venetian mode (up/down and slate rotation)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE1</strong&gt: After parameter change, first exclude module (without setting parameters to default value) then wait at least 30s and then re include the module!</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_72_2
parameter.label: 72: Slats tilting full turn time
parameter.description: Slats tilting full turn time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the time necessary for slats to make full turn (180 degrees).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 150 = 1,5 seconds</li&gt <li&gt0 - tilting time disabled</li&gt <li&gt1 - 32767 = 0,01seconds - 327,67 seconds</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE</strong&gt: If time set is too high, this will result that after full turn, Shutter will start move up/down, for time remaining. </p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_73_1
parameter.label: 73: Slats position
parameter.description: Slats position<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines slats position after up/down movement through Z-wave or push-buttons.</p&gt</p&gt

options.option: Return to previous position only with Z-wave
Return to previous position with Z-wave or button

parameter.name: config_74_2
parameter.label: 74: Motor moving up/down time
parameter.description: Motor moving up/down time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines Shutter motor moving time of complete opening or complete closing.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt0 - moving time disabled (working with limit switches)</li&gt <li&gt1 - 32767 = 0,1seconds - 3276,7seconds. After that time motor is stopped (relay goes to off state)</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE</strong&gt: Important is that the reference position to manually set moving time is always Shutter lower position!</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_76_1
parameter.label: 76: Motor operation detection
parameter.description: Motor operation detection<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtPower threshold to be interpreted when motor reach the limit switch.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gt default value 6 = 0,6W</li&gt <li&gt5 - 100 (0,5W - 10W), step is 0,1W.</li&gt </ul&gt<p&gt<strong&gtNOTE</strong&gt: Motors with power consumption less than 0,5W could not be auto calibrated. In that case set time manually (par. 74).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_78_1
parameter.label: 78: Forced Shutter DC calibration
parameter.description: Forced Shutter DC calibration<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtBy modifying the parameters setting from 0 to 1 a Shutter DC module enters the calibration mode.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 0</li&gt <li&gt1 - Start calibration process (when calibration process is finished, completing full cycle - up, down and up, set the parameter 78 (Forced Shutter calibration) value back to 0</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_85_1
parameter.label: 85: Power consumption max delay time
parameter.description: Power consumption max delay time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the max time before motor power consumption is read after one of the relays is switched ON. If there is no power consumption during this max time (motor not connected, damaged or requires higher time to start, motor in end position,...) the relay will switch OFF. Time is defined by entering it manually.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 8 = 800ms</li&gt <li&gt3 - 50 = 0,3seconds - 5seconds (100ms resolution)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_86_1
parameter.label: 86: Power consumption at limit switch delay time
parameter.description: Power consumption at limit switch delay time<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the max time at limit switch, when power consumption is below power threshold. If the power consumption during this time is below power threshold (par. 76), the active output will switch off, means that limit switch is reached.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 8 = 800ms</li&gt <li&gt3 - 50 = 0,3seconds - 5seconds (100ms resolution) </li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_90_1
parameter.label: 90: Time delay for next motor movement
parameter.description: Time delay for next motor movement<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis parameter defines the minimum time delay between next motor movement (minimum time between switching motor off and on again).</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters </p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 5 = 500ms</li&gt <li&gt1 - 30 = 0,1seconds - 3seconds (100ms resolution)</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_110_2
parameter.label: 110: Temperature sensor offset settings
parameter.description: Temperature sensor offset settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtSet value is added or subtracted to actual measured value by sensor.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtdefault value 32536  32536 - offset is 0.0C</li&gt <li&gtFrom 1 to 100 - value from 0.1 °C to 10.0 °C is added to actual measured temperature.</li&gt <li&gtFrom 1001 to 1100 - value from -0.1 °C to -10.0 °C is subtracted to actual measured temperature.</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_120_1
parameter.label: 120: Digital temperature sensor reporting
parameter.description: Digital temperature sensor reporting<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf digital temperature sensor is connected, module reports measured temperature on temperature change defined by this parameter.</p&gt <p&gtAvailable configuration parameters (data type is 1 Byte DEC):</p&gt <ul&gt<li&gtDefault value 5 = 0,5°C</li&gt <li&gt0 - reporting disabled</li&gt <li&gt1-127 = 0,1°C - 12,7°C, step is 0,1°C</li&gt </ul&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: group_2
parameter.label: 2: Basic on/off - input I1
parameter.description: Triggered at change of the input I1 state and reflecting its state

parameter.name: group_3
parameter.label: 3: Basic on/off - input I2
parameter.description: Triggered at change of the input I2 state and reflecting its state

parameter.name: group_4
parameter.label: 4: Basic on/off - direction of roller
parameter.description: Triggered at sensing moving direction of roller<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtup=FF, down=0</p&gt

parameter.name: group_5
parameter.label: 5: Basic on/off - roller position
parameter.description: Triggered at reaching roller position<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtbottom=FF, top=0</p&gt

parameter.name: group_6
parameter.label: 6: Basic on/off
parameter.description: Triggered at reaching roller position<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtbottom=FF, not bottom=0</p&gt

parameter.name: group_7
parameter.label: 7: Multilevel set
parameter.description: triggered at changes of value of the Flush Shutter DC position

parameter.name: group_8
parameter.label: 8: Multilevel set
parameter.description: Triggered at changes of value of slats tilting position

parameter.name: group_9
parameter.label: 9: Multilevel sensor report
parameter.description: Triggered at change of temperature sensor
